render.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to cause someone or something to be in a particular condition
render.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He was rendered almost speechless by the news.
The blow to his head was strong enough to render him unconscious.
render.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to
render.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
a bill of $3200 for services rendered (=for something you have done)
It is unlikely that the court will render an opinion before November 5.
render.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to express or present something in a particular way
render.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: She made a sound that in print is rendered as ‘harrumph’.
Infrared film renders blue skies a deep black.
render.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to spread plaster or cement on the surface of a wall
render.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: a brick wall that has been rendered and whitewashed
render.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to melt the fat of an animal as you cook it
render.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Steam the goose to render some of the fat.
render.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to cause something to change in a particular way
render.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: He was denied building permission for his property, effectively rendering it worthless.
In some cases, companies were rendered insolvent when they took on big debts in the buy-outs.
render.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to officially present a company’s accounts showing its profits and losses to people who own shares in it or have another interest in seeing the accounts
render.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The petition claims the company failed to render proper accounts.
render.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to officially make a decision etc about something
render.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The union hopes the board will render a verdict on the dispute this summer.
render.translation[1].definitions[3].def: work that has been done, and that is due for payment
render.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: Employees who left were barred from collecting payment for services rendered before they withdrew.
